blockquote.p: A uniform_real_distribution random number distribution produces random numbers x, a ≤ x < b,
-2- Requires: a ≤ b and b - a ≤ numeric_limits<RealType>::max().

discussion.p:
If you construct a uniform_real_distribution<RealType>(a, b) where there are no representable numbers between 'a' and 'b' (using RealType's representation) then you cannot satisfy .
An obvious example is when a == b.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4140.

li.p: Add a note after paragraph 1 before the synopsis in :

blockquote.p: -1- A uniform_real_distribution random number distribution produces random numbers x, a ≤ x < b, distributed according to the constant probability density function

p.ins: [Note: This implies that P(i|a, b) is undefined when a == b. — end note]
